Here are the best places to buy a beach house. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

A beach house to call home

When you really love the coast, there's no need to keep your vacation to a few weeks a year. Our Best Places to Buy a Beach House report takes a look at the top waterfront vacation rental destinations where purchasing a second home has the sunniest outlook.

Read the Full Report
 

Gulf Shores, Alabama

Boasting over 32 miles of sandy white beaches, Gulf Shores is a mecca of pure paradise on the Alabama coastline. A Gulf Shores vacation home or condo will cost around $400,000, but can yield over $50,000 of revenue per year. How’s that for Southern hospitality?

Explore Gulf Shores Vacation Rentals ›

 

Corolla, North Carolina

The popularity of the Outer Banks may have grown given its national exposure on a hit reality show, but those who have been traveling there for years have always admired the area’s subtle charm and wide open spaces. The fact that a vacation rental property in Corolla could net you approximately $77,000 in median annual gross rental revenue only shores up the investment.

Explore Corolla Vacation Rentals ›

 

Navarre Beach, Florida

Here, relaxation is the name of the game, and visitors can mostly be found sunning and swimming in the area’s emerald waters. If you’re able to scoop up a spot on the sand in Navarre Beach, the median home sale price sits under $400,000, and could bring in an annual rental revenue of $43,202.

Explore Navarre Beach Vacation Rentals ›

 

New Buffalo, Michigan

The Gateway of Michigan may not immediately strike your fancy as a Best Place to Buy a Beach House, but take a closer look, and you’ll find the beach-like lakeshore rivals any destination on our list. With a median home sale price of $569,873 your midwestern escape could earn you just over $58,000 a year. (All the more to adventure with.)

Explore New Buffalo Vacation Rentals ›
